definition[0]: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future
example[1]: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
definition[1]: a feeling of doubt because you do not agree completely with a plan, idea, or suggestion
example[2]: We condemn their actions without reservation  (=completely).
example[3]: I had serious reservations about his appointment as captain.
definition[2]: an area of land in the US kept separate for Native Americans to live on
definition[3]: an area of land where wild animals can live without being hunted
heading[0]: – Meaning 1: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future
example[7]: We have a reservation for seven o'clock.
example[8]: We will send you an email to confirm your reservation.
example[9]: She called the restaurant and cancelled the reservations.
example[10]: I'd forgotten to make a dinner reservation.
example[12]: Make sure you have an airline reservation before booking the hotel.
heading[1]: – Meaning 2: a feeling of doubt because you do not agree completely with a plan, idea, or suggestion
example[13]: I have reservations about her work.
example[14]: I did not think it wise to express my reservations.
example[15]: Despite some reservations, I recommend this book.
example[16]: They had serious reservations about the plan.
example[17]: Five of the committee members expressed strong reservations about the product's safety.
example[18]: We have considerable reservations about the government's economic proposals.
example[19]: I voted "yes", although I had a few minor reservations
example[20]: We have major reservations about his ability to do the job.
definition[4]: an arrangement in which a place on a plane, in a hotel, in a restaurant etc is kept for a customer who will arrive later
example[21]: Every passenger is guaranteed a seat without a reservation.
